thread.title: French elections: mass celebrations following the victory of the left in the parliamentary elections
thread.title_full: French elections: mass celebrations following the victory of the left in the parliamentary elections

author: archyde
title: French elections: mass celebrations following the victory of the left in the parliamentary elections
text:
Caption: The streets of Paris were packed with people on Sunday during the second round of voting. Article information
Author, Editorial Role, BBC News World 7 julio 2024
The results of the parliamentary elections in France brought joy to thousands of people who had taken to the streets to wait for their compatriots to finish casting their votes.
Following the historic advance of the far-right National Rally party during the first round, analysts were pointing out that this party led by Marine Le Pen was on the verge of governing.
But the strategy of several centrist and left-wing candidates to drop out of the race in order to consolidate the vote turned the results around, and the left-wing alliance New Popular Front led the vote.
Celebrations – and long faces – in the face of the result were the main features of the day.
Photo caption: The Place de la République in Paris was the place chosen by thousands of people to celebrate this Sunday.
Image source, EPA
Caption: Many people gathered to watch the election results together, given the importance of the vote for France.
Image source, Reuters
Photo caption: The celebrations were particularly massive in Paris, where citizens carried slogans with the French triptych “Liberty, Equality and Fraternity.”
Image source, EPA
Photo caption: At the protests, signs could be read with phrases such as “the extreme right will not pass.”
Image source, EPA
Caption: Celebrations spread across different parts of the country: in Marseille, in the south of France, citizens declared “Marseille, proud and popular citizen”.
Image source, EPA
Caption: After celebrating the results of the first round, supporters of Le Pen and the National Rally party were shocked to see their victory crumble.
Image source, EPA
Photo caption: The atmosphere was gloomy at the headquarters of the National Group. Photo caption: A group of people burst into jubilation when the first results were announced.
